text: Gilbert M. "Broncho Billy" Anderson (born Maxwell Henry Aronson; March 21, 1880 â€“ January 20, 1971) was an American actor, writer, director, and movie producer. He was the first star of the Western movie genre. He was a founder and star for Essanay studios. In 1958, he received an Honorary Academy Award. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Category:1880 births Category:1971 deaths Category:Academy Award Honorary Award winners Category:American silent movie actors Category:American stage actors Category:Movie directors from California Category:Movie producers from California Category:Actors from Pasadena, California Category:Writers from Pasadena, California Category:Businesspeople from California Category:Actors from Little Rock, Arkansas Category:Writers from Little Rock, Arkansas Category:Businesspeople from Arkansas
title: Broncho Billy Anderson
